title: Typhoon: The Ultimate Aquatic All-Terrain Beast
description: The Typhoon by Shadow Six Racing is a high-performance fusion of an all-terrain vehicle and a watercraft, designed for motorsports enthusiasts and defense applications. Dubbed the “first aquatic utility vehicle ever,” this 2,365-pound machine accommodates up to three passengers and is built with aerospace-grade titanium and carbon fiber for durability and lightweight performance.
author: Your Future Machine | TTAC Creator
excerpt: The Typhoon by Shadow Six Racing is a high-performance fusion of an all-terrain vehicle and a watercraft, designed for motorsports enthusiasts and defense applications.Dubbed the “first aquatic utility vehicle ever,” this 2,365-pound machine accommodates up to three passengers and is built with aerospace-grade titanium and carbon fiber for durability and lightweight performance.Powered by a twin-supercharged Yamaha GP1800 SVHO engine, the Typhoon boasts speeds of over 80 mph, according to Man of Many.With an MSRP of $250,399, this aquatic marvel redefines off-road adventure.

html:
Published:  May 1st, 2025

The Typhoon by Shadow Six Racing is a high-performance fusion of an all-terrain vehicle and a watercraft, designed for motorsports enthusiasts and defense applications. Dubbed the “first aquatic utility vehicle ever,” this 2,365-pound machine accommodates up to three passengers and is built with aerospace-grade titanium and carbon fiber for durability and lightweight performance.

Powered by a twin-supercharged Yamaha GP1800 SVHO engine, the Typhoon boasts speeds of over 80 mph, according to Man of Many. With an MSRP of $250,399, this aquatic marvel redefines off-road adventure. Learn more at shadowsixracing.com.

{ "id": "9636331", "alt": "", "title": "", "video_link": "https://www.youtube.com/embed/rtWIbQ4Onr0", "youtube_video_id": "rtWIbQ4Onr0" }

{ "width": 634, "height": 357, "showRelated": true }

Join the conversation

  • So someone bolted a side-by-side on top of two wave runners? This is part Mad-Max, and something my 10 year old self would dream up. I can't wait for some backyard builder to make a DYI version. I worked with a guy who was always searching or random bits to build his own hovercraft using various go-cart, jet ski and riding mower parts.

  • Yes but can it outrun a Canadian icebreaker?
